title: Cross-Project Session Visibility in Dashboard
body:
## Problem

Active agent sessions (architect + ticket agents) are only visible within a single project's kanban view. There is no way to see all running sessions across all projects at once.

## Solution

Add an "Active Sessions" panel to the daemon dashboard TUI that aggregates all running sessions across registered projects.

### Layout

```
Active Sessions
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│ ● [Cortex]  Architect          running       2h 15m    │
│ ● [Cortex]  fix-auth-bug       in_progress      45m   │
│ ● [My App]  Architect          running       1h 30m    │
│ ○ [My App]  add-dark-mode      review           12m   │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Session data

Each session entry shows:
- Project name
- Window/ticket name
- Session status (from ticket status tracking)
- Duration (time since session started)

## Dependencies

- Daemon Dashboard TUI

## Scope

- Aggregate active sessions across all project stores
- Display in a dedicated panel on the dashboard
- Show session duration (computed from `session.started_at`)
- Update in real-time via SSE events
- Verify tmux window still exists for each session (handle stale sessions)

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Dashboard displays all active sessions across all projects
- [ ] Each session shows project name, ticket/window name, status, and duration
- [ ] Sessions update in real-time as they start/complete
- [ ] Stale sessions (tmux window gone) are detected and indicated
